qas.question: The notation of music on a what began to take shape at this time?
How was music transmitted before the invention of musical notation?
What was oral music subject to every time is was transmitted?
What can a musical scored be performed without?
When was the movable-type printing press invented?

context: It is in this time that the notation of music on a <a0_0>staff<a0_0/> and other elements of musical notation began to take shape. This invention made possible the separation of the composition of a piece of music from its transmission; without written music, transmission was <a1_0>oral<a1_0/>, and subject to <a2_0>change<a2_0/> every time it was transmitted. With a musical score, a work of music could be performed without <a3_0>the composer's presence<a3_0/>. The invention of the movable-type printing press in <a4_0>the 15th century<a4_0/> had far-reaching consequences on the preservation and transmission of music.
